p: Rhinovirus infections typically begin with a sore throat, soon followed by nasal congestion, rhinorrhea, cough, and sneezing. As the illness progresses, sore throat symptoms tend to resolve quickly, and the initially watery rhinorrhea becomes increasingly purulent. Fever is uncommon among adults with colds, but is more frequent in children with viral respiratory infections. Common cold symptoms peak in severity within 2–3 days of onset, and have a mean duration of 7–10 days [ 14].
